metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4430 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The dump_resource function in dird/dird_conf.c in Bacula before 5.2.11 does not properly enforce ACL rules, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain resource dump information via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bacula - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-client - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common-mysql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common-pgsql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common-sqlite3 - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-console - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-console-qt - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-common - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-mysql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-pgsql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-sqlite3 - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-fd - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-sd - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-sd-mysql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-sd-pgsql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-sd-sqlite3 - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-server - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-traymonitor - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bacula package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.6+dfsg-4').
